page.title: 02 HOUSING IN DAGENHAM
page.content: On arrival in Dagenham a visitor invariably becomes lost, simply becauseones first impressions suggest that the town (from{any}direction) looks the same _ namely row upon row of terraced,post 1930 houses. A closer inspection will reveal that this is not entirely the case. There are as many as{28 structural differences} between the houses, which pass unrecognised because certain basic designs are re-created throughout the area. The houses maintain one common factor _{height,}thus giving the impression of uniformity. Amongst the visible differences are: red brick,pebble dash or wooden facing, shared entrances, and dorma windows. Recent developments include flats and maisonettes for younger families.
